overview: In this subject, students undertake a substantial research program in the area of Mathematics and Statistics. The research will be conducted under the supervision of a member of the School's academic staff. A list of the research interests of the School of Mathematics and Statistics is outlined on thewebsite of the School. The results will be reported in the form of a thesis and an oral presentation.
intended learning outcomes: discovered the challenge of research in Mathematics and Statistics;
a deeper knowledge of Mathematics and Statistics;
completed a substantial piece of research; and
a sound preparation for future research in Mathematics or Statistics.

additional pre-requisite: This research project option is only available to students in special cases, and only with approval of the Master of Science (Mathematics and Statistics) program coordinator.

assessments.description: A preliminary literature survey and research plan (pass/fail). 2 pages. Hurdle requirement
assessments.timing: At the end of week eight of Minor Research Project Part 1

assessments.description: A thesis is the main requirement. Theses are expected to be 30-40 pages in length, excluding references, appendices, figures and tables. Two bound hard copies of the thesis are to be submitted two weeks prior to the end of the teaching period in the final semester of Research project enrolment. 30-40 pages
assessments.timing: After the full 25 points of enrolment in the Minor Research Project component

assessments.description: Students will have to give presentations on their research projects in the last week of that teaching period. 15 minutes
assessments.timing: On a date to be announced by the Department of Mathematics and Statistics at the beginning of semester

Semester 1 (Extended).Contact hours: This subject is an individual research project and weekly contact hours will vary depending on the nature of the project.

Semester 2 (Extended).Contact hours: This subject is an individual research project and weekly contact hours will vary depending on the nature of the project.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
